1.4. Documentation ConventionsÂ¶

This manual uses certain typographical and syntactic conventions:

Text

  • Text in this style is used for file names, variables, functions, and other parts of source code.
  • Text in this style is used for emphasis.
  • Text in this style is used for strong emphasis. It is also used for table headings and in-text headings.

Code Blocks and Syntax

  • Source code will be placed into blocks.

    Content in this format represents source code in C, C++, SQL, etc.

  • $ will represent a prompt at which commands are entered.

    $ command --flag argument

  • A name between angle brackets (<>) will signify information that must be supplied by the user.

    <file-name>

  • NULL is used for C/C++ NULL pointers.

  • null is used for null values in SQL or stored in a database.

Admonitions

Tip

This is a tip.

This is used to give helpful advice and suggestions.

Note

This is a note.

This is used to add emphasis to general information.

Important

This is a important information.

This is used to add extra emphasis to general information.

Warning

This is a warning.

This is used to introduce cautions and potential dangers.
